Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Lower part of a statue of Hor-em-tabat
Description: Lower part of an inscribed, kneeling statue. The figure is leaning against a flat back pillar, resting his buttocks on his heels. The toes are splayed. Between the thighs is the horizontally pleated middle part of the kilt; further pleats can be seen above the ankles. Between the legs is a smooth bridge of stone. The high base is rounded at the front. The preserved right back part is cut off at an angle.
